properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 31 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
An area of light to occasionally moderate snow will progress
across northern Illinois through the overnight hours into early
Saturday, possibly mixing with rain initially over Chicago. Wet
snow accumulations of a coating to a half inch are possible on
grassy and colder surfaces. In the pre-dawn hours of Saturday into
Saturday morning, as the precipitation tapers off, it may mix
with or change to patchy freezing drizzle in northwest Cook
County. Slick spots will be possible on some roadways from the
accumulating wet snow and then wintry mix, especially on
untreated, elevated, or less heavily traveled roads outside of
Chicago. In addition, patchy dense fog is possible overnight into
Saturday morning. Motorists are advised to reduce speed and use
extra caution when driving tonight into Saturday morning.

NWSheadline: Snow Tonight then Fog and Possible Freezing Drizzle Northwest Cook County Early Saturday
